dct_description_sm: Topographic map of showing Haut-Rhin (Germany), dated to around 1915, with northern tip of Switzerland (including Basel) and eastern France.
Verlag v. Fr. Paul Lorenz Kartographische Verlagsanstalt ; Stich u. Druck der Lithogr. Anstalt. v. F. Wirtz, Darmstadt.
Relief shown by contours and spot heights.
Legend shows various boundaries, roads, railways, forests, waterways, various locations (such as forts, castles, churches, ruins, cities), bridges.
Haut-Rhin department belongs to Germany on this map, dating it before Treaty of Versailles, 1919. Basel also lacks Dreirosenbr√ºcke (bridge--finished 1934).
